sentence.text: Patient 3 is presently a 39-year-old male with an adult height of 156.7 cm.
He was first evaluated for mild short stature (height Z-score −2.5 to −2.7) at 6.3 years.
Bone age was delayed (5 years) and the very mild metaphyseal irregularities were regarded normal.
At 14 years, his height Z-score was −1.6 but pubertal growth spurt was subnormal resulting in short stature by adulthood (Z-score −3.3).
The diagnosis of CHH was made at 8 years.
During the first years of life, he had recurrent otitis media but no other infections since then except for rare mild URTIs.
